verses.verse: Guard <S%H8104><s%> your steps <S%H7272><s%> when you go <S%H3212><s%> to God <S%H430><s%>'s house; <S%H1004><s%> for to draw near <S%H7138><s%> to listen <S%H8085><s%> is better than to give <S%H5414><s%> the sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> of fools, <S%H3684><s%> for they don't <S%H3045><s%> know that they do <S%H6213><s%> evil. <S%H7451><s%>

Don't <S%H926><s%> be rash with your mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and don't <S%H3820><s%> let your heart be hasty <S%H4116><s%> to utter <S%H3318><s%> anything <S%H1697><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God; <S%H430><s%> for God <S%H430><s%> is in heaven, <S%H8064><s%> and you on earth. <S%H776><s%> Therefore let your words <S%H1697><s%> be few. <S%H4592><s%>

For as a dream <S%H2472><s%> comes <S%H935><s%> with a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of cares, <S%H6045><s%> so a fool <S%H3684><s%>'s speech <S%H6963><s%> with a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of words. <S%H1697><s%>

When you vow <S%H5087><s%> a vow <S%H5088><s%> to God, <S%H430><s%> don't <S%H309><s%> defer to pay <S%H7999><s%> it; <S%H2656><s%> for he has no pleasure in fools. <S%H3684><s%> Pay <S%H7999><s%> that which you vow. <S%H5087><s%>
It is better <S%H2896><s%> that you should not vow, <S%H5087><s%> than that you should vow <S%H5087><s%> and not pay. <S%H7999><s%>

Don't <S%H5414><s%> allow your mouth <S%H6310><s%> to lead you <S%H1320><s%> into sin. <S%H2398><s%> Don't <S%H559><s%> protest before <S%H6440><s%> the messenger <S%H4397><s%> that this was a mistake. <S%H7684><s%> Why should God <S%H430><s%> be angry <S%H7107><s%> at your voice, <S%H6963><s%> and destroy <S%H2254><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> of your hands? <S%H3027><s%>
For in the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of dreams <S%H2472><s%> there are vanities, <S%H1892><s%> as well as in many <S%H7235><s%> words: <S%H1697><s%> but you must fear <S%H3372><s%> God. <S%H430><s%>

If you see <S%H7200><s%> the oppression <S%H6233><s%> of the poor, <S%H7326><s%> and the violent <S%H1499><s%> taking away of justice <S%H6664><s%> and righteousness <S%H4941><s%> in a district, <S%H4082><s%> don't <S%H8539><s%> marvel at the matter: <S%H2656><s%> for one official <S%H1364><s%> is eyed <S%H8104><s%> by a higher <S%H1364><s%> one; <S%H1364><s%> and there are officials over them. <S%H5921><s%>
Moreover the profit <S%H3504><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> is for all. <S%H4428><s%> The king profits <S%H5647><s%> from the field. <S%H7704><s%>

He who loves <S%H157><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> shall not be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with silver; <S%H3701><s%> nor he who loves <S%H157><s%> abundance, <S%H1995><s%> with increase: <S%H8393><s%> this also is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

When goods <S%H2896><s%> increase, <S%H7235><s%> those who eat <S%H398><s%> them are increased; <S%H7231><s%> and what advantage <S%H3788><s%> is there to its owner, <S%H1167><s%> except <S%H518><s%> to feast <S%H7207><s%> on them with his eyes? <S%H5869><s%>

The sleep <S%H8142><s%> of a laboring man <S%H5647><s%> is sweet, <S%H4966><s%> whether he eats <S%H398><s%> little <S%H4592><s%> or much; <S%H7235><s%> but the abundance <S%H7647><s%> of the rich <S%H6223><s%> will not allow <S%H3240><s%> him to sleep. <S%H3462><s%>

There is <S%H3426><s%> a grievous <S%H2470><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> which I have seen <S%H7200><s%> under the sun: <S%H8121><s%> wealth <S%H6239><s%> kept <S%H8104><s%> by its owner <S%H1167><s%> to his harm. <S%H7451><s%>

Those riches <S%H6239><s%> perish <S%H6><s%> by <S%H6045><s%> misfortune, <S%H7451><s%> and if he has fathered <S%H3205><s%> a son, <S%H1121><s%> there is nothing <S%H3972><s%> in his hand. <S%H3027><s%>

As he came forth <S%H3318><s%> from his mother <S%H517><s%>'s womb, <S%H990><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> shall he go <S%H3212><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> as he came, <S%H935><s%> and shall take <S%H5375><s%> nothing <S%H3972><s%> for his labor, <S%H5999><s%> which he may carry away <S%H3212><s%> in his hand. <S%H3027><s%>

This <S%H2090><s%> also is a grievous <S%H2470><s%> evil, <S%H7451><s%> that in all points <S%H5980><s%> as he came, <S%H935><s%> so shall he go. <S%H3212><s%> And what profit <S%H3504><s%> does he have who labors <S%H5998><s%> for the wind? <S%H7307><s%>
All his days <S%H3117><s%> he also eats <S%H398><s%> in darkness, <S%H2822><s%> he is <S%H7235><s%> frustrated, <S%H3707><s%> and has sickness <S%H2483><s%> and wrath. <S%H7110><s%>

Behold, <S%H7200><s%> that which I have seen to be good <S%H2896><s%> and proper <S%H3303><s%> is for one to eat <S%H398><s%> and to drink, <S%H8354><s%> and to enjoy <S%H7200><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> in all his labor, <S%H5999><s%> in which he labors <S%H5998><s%> under the sun, <S%H8121><s%> all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life <S%H2416><s%> which God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> him; <S%H2506><s%> for this is his portion.

Every man <S%H120><s%> also to whom God <S%H430><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> riches <S%H6239><s%> and wealth, <S%H5233><s%> and has given him power <S%H7980><s%> to eat <S%H398><s%> of it, <S%H5375><s%> and to take his portion, <S%H2506><s%> and to rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in his labor <S%H5999><s%> â€” this <S%H2090><s%> is the gift <S%H4991><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>

For he shall not often <S%H7235><s%> reflect <S%H2142><s%> on the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life; <S%H2416><s%> because God <S%H430><s%> occupies <S%H6031><s%> him with the joy <S%H8057><s%> of his heart. <S%H3820><s%>
